required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase I, Open Label Dose Ranging Safety Study of GLS-5300 in Healthy Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: Phase I, Open-label, Dose Ranging Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, and Immunogenicity of GLS-5300, Administered IM Followed by Electroporation in Healthy Volunteers

collaborator.agency: Walter Reed Army Institute of Research (WRAIR)

brief_summary.textblock: The Middle East Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus (MERS CoV), a virus related to Severe Acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus (SARS CoV), was first recognized as a cause of severe pulmonary infection in 2012. Infection with MERS CoV has been diagnosed in more than 1600 individuals with a mortality rate between 35% and 40%. GLS-5300 is a DNA plasmid vaccine that expresses the MERS CoV spike (S) glycoprotein. This study will evaluate the safety of GLS-5300 at one of three dose levels following a three-injection vaccination regimen followed by electroporation. The study will also assess immune responses over a 1 year period with respect to the generation of antibody and cellular responses.

detailed_description.textblock: GLS-5300 is a DNA plasmid vaccine that expresses the MERS CoV spike (S) glycoprotein. Following administration of the vaccine, a specialized medical device, CELLECTRA®, will deliver brief electrical pulses in a process known as electroporation (EP), to help move DNA into cells more efficiently.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean change from baseline in safety laboratory measures
Incidence of solicited adverse events after vaccination
Incidence of unsolicited adverse events after vaccination

secondary_outcome.measure: Binding antibody response to S protein
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day0 through Week 60 following the first dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Neutralizing antibody response to S protein
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day0 through Week 60 following the first dose
Day 0 through Week 60 following the first dose

overall_official.affiliation: Walter Reed Army Institute of Research (WRAIR)
